content:
Here's the result of running `cat -n` on /workspace/solution.py:
     1	n = int(input())
     2	s = input().strip()
     3	
     4	# Count unique substrings that are repetitions of one character
     5	unique_substrings = set()
     6	
     7	# For each position in the string, find all substrings starting at that position
     8	# that consist of a single repeated character
     9	i = 0
    10	while i < len(s):
    11	    char = s[i]
    12	    j = i
    13	    # Find the end of the consecutive run of this character
    14	    while j < len(s) and s[j] == char:
    15	        j += 1
    16	
    17	    # For this run of length (j - i), we can have substrings of lengths 1 to (j - i)
    18	    # Each of these will be unique (e.g., "a", "aa", "aaa", etc.)
    19	    run_length = j - i
    20	    for length in range(1, run_length + 1):
    21	        unique_substrings.add(char * length)
    22	
    23	    i = j
    24	
    25	print(len(unique_substrings))
